function_reachability: Is it impossible for function 'printf' to reach function 'malloc'?

loop_reachability: Is it possible that the loop with condition 'current != NULL' is never executed?
Is the loop with condition 'current != NULL' always executed?

Is the loop with condition 'node != NULL && node->val != val' always executed?
dominators: Is there at least one path that reaches the body of the loop with condition 'current != NULL' without passing through its header block?
Is there at least one path that reaches the body of the loop with condition 'node != NULL && node->val != val' without passing through its header block?
data_dependency: Is variable 'node (line 3)' used after its definition?
Is variable 'val (line 4)' used after its definition?
liveness: Is variable 'node (line 3)' live at the end of function 'make_node'?
Does variable 'val (line 4)' remain in use at the end of function 'make_node'?
dead_code: Can the program actually reach the statement: “Node *next_node;”?
